content.title: Gastroduodenal Artery Aneurysm
content.description: Rare visceral aneurysm often associated with pancreatitis or as collateral from celiac stenosis.

clinical_features.presentation: May rupture into GI tract causing hematemesis

treatment_approach.surgical: Ligation proximal and distal or resection

content.clinical_pearl: GDA aneurysm in setting of celiac occlusion serves as critical collateral; treat celiac stenosis first
content.statement: Gastroduodenal Artery Aneurysm is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Mesenteric that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Gastroduodenal Artery Aneurysm helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Gastroduodenal Artery Aneurysm include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Gastroduodenal Artery Aneurysm.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Gastroduodenal Artery Aneurysm. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
